cab.content: 212(This Document is the Property of his^gnta-v?^ Majesty'a G') v^owv^t)^Military Secret. 1309"From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,28th February 1920.(Received 1st March.)Malleson wires 24th February: " Chard jui, 2nd February. During past few days two squadrons Cavalry, 300 Infantry, with 40 machine guns and four mountain batteries have arrived at Chardjui. Local rumour that machine guns and batteries are to be sent up river, possibly for Afghanistan. Bolshevik intention is to press forward with all speed reopening of rail communication with Termez, which is to be used as a base for despatch of troops, munitions of war and stores to Afghanistan. Local Bolshevik (corrupt group) troops from centre arrived in Turkestan during last five months total between 40,000-50,000 men."
